body_html: cron/build_docker.sh is quite coupled to the nightlies setup. But https://github.com/pytorch/builder/blob/master/manywheel/build.sh will build a wheel without needing to set most of those environment variables if you run it in a soumith/manylinux-cuda80 (you'll have to checkout the pytorch/builder repo but it comes with git). I think you'd only have to set DESIRED_PYTHON and DESIRED_CUDA. That way it won't require a nightlies folder to store all the nightlies metadata and logs
